title: (x) close match to ï¿½Father's House" logo - various {gang}
content: This looks to me like the work of either Philip Bouwsma or Arthur Baker. I am looking for it in my Script Guide.
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
My own recommendations would be two of Bouwsma's calligraphic faces: [Mantegna Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124539/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5GN) and [Polenta (formerly Donatello) Black Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124539/http:/www.identifont.com/show?5I0).   
   
These were the closest I saw in running through the Calligraphic scripts in [Part 4 of the Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124539/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script04Pg1.html). Polenta has a lighter weight too.
Say, isn't that apostrophe the [Dove](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124539/http:/www.dove.com/) logo?

To all:   
   
Thanks for the help and the new resources to look at for identifying font faces, I thought I had seen most of them, but I'm not even close!   
   
I will take your suggestions and see which flies with the powers that be, and speaking of flying, the dove does look an awful lot like the Dove logo... I never noticed it before.   
   
Philip Bouwsma does good work, I like most of his typefaces.   
   
Thanks again
